page.title: 16LIFE IN OULTON VILLAGE-1930
page.content: (Memories recalled by MR. Gordon Wilson, Oulton Village resident all his life, and resident of Oulton Road for 40 years.) "The terraced houses in Oulton Broad were built in 1903. Our rent was 25 old pence weekly. We had 4 shops, a dairy and 2 public houses in Oulton in those days. Today we have only 1 shop, 1 post office store and 1 public house. On land where modern houses stand today there were orchards and open fields. Most people worked on the land and some were fishermen. They usually began work at the age of 14.My first job was at Decoy Farm, Flixton where I earned 14 shillings a week. A pint of milk was 2 old pence and 24 eggs cost 5 pence in those days. Adults wore their working clothes all week and only changed into their best clothes on a Sunday."
